metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17101 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in LibTIFF 4.0.9. There are two out-of-boundswrites in cpTags in tools/tiff2bw.c and tools/pal2rgb.c, which can cause adenial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a crafted image file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17101` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.10
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.10
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.10
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.10').
